cookingTips: Blanching and scrubbing the bones is essential—this removes impurities that would cloud your broth and create a cleaner, more refined final product.
Maintain a vigorous simmer rather than a rolling boil to extract maximum collagen and flavor while keeping the broth clear. Add water gradually as it reduces to maintain liquid level.
The broth should turn opaque and creamy from emulsified bone marrow and collagen, typically after 3-4 hours total simmering. Don't rush this process.
Cook fresh ramen noodles al dente (firm texture) for 2-3 minutes—overcooked noodles will become mushy and absorb too much broth.
Prepare chashu pork belly in advance (braised and sliced); assemble the final bowls quickly by warming broth and noodles just before serving to preserve texture and temperature.
